rule.name: access
rule.description: A potential TOCTOU (Time Of Check, Time Of Use) vulnerability exists. This is the first line where a check has occured.

rule.name: creat
rule.description: A potential race condition vulnerability exists here. Normally a call to this function is vulnerable only when a match check precedes it.

rule.name: drand48
rule.description: Standard random number generators should not be used to generate randomness used for security reasons. For security sensitive randomness a crytographic randomness generator that provides sufficient entropy should be used.

rule.name: chroot
rule.description: Do not forget to chdir() to an appropriate directory before calling chroot()!

rule.name: gets
rule.description: Gets is unsafe!! No bounds checking is performed, buffer is easily overflowable by user. Use fgets(buf, size, stdin) instead.

rule.name: system
rule.description: Argument 1 to this function call should be checked to ensure that it does not come from an untrusted source without first verifying that it contains nothing dangerous.

rule.name: popen
rule.description: Argument 1 to this function call should be checked to ensure that it does not come from an untrusted source without first verifying that it contains nothing dangerous.

rule.name: getenv
rule.description: Environment variables are highly untrustable input. They may be of any length, and contain any data. Do not make any assumptions regarding content or length. If at all possible avoid using them, and if it is necessary, sanitize them and truncate them to a reasonable length.

rule.name: strcpy
rule.description: Check to be sure that argument 2 passed to this function call will not copy more data than can be handled, resulting in a buffer overflow.

rule.name: strcat
rule.description: Check to be sure that argument 2 passed to this function call will not copy more data than can be handled, resulting in a buffer overflow.

rule.name: printf
rule.description: Check to be sure that the non-constant format string passed as argument 1 to this function call does not come from an untrusted source that could have added formatting characters that the code is not prepared to handle.

rule.name: sprintf
rule.description: Check to be sure that the format string passed as argument 2 to this function call does not come from an untrusted source that could have added formatting characters that the code is not prepared to handle. Additionally, the format string could contain `%s' without precision that could result in a buffer overflow.

rule.name: wsprintf
rule.description: Check to be sure that the format string passed as argument 2 to this function call does not come from an untrusted source that could have added formatting characters that the code is not prepared to handle. Additionally, the format string could contain `%s' without precision that could result in a buffer overflow.

rule.name: _snprintf
rule.description: Double check that your buffer is as big as you specify. When using functions that accept a number n of bytes to copy, such as strncpy, be aware that if the dest buffer size = n it may not NULL-terminate the string.

rule.name: MultiByteToWideChar
rule.description: The last argument is the number of wide chars, not the number of bytes. Getting this wrong can cause a buffer overflow since you will indicate that the buffer is twice the size it actually is. Don't forget about NULL termination.

rule.name: LoadLibrary
rule.description: LoadLibrary will search several places for a library if no path is specified, allowing trojan DLL's to be inserted elsewhere even if the intended DLL is correctly protected from overwriting. Make sure to specify the full path.

rule.name: LoadLibraryA
rule.description: LoadLibrary will search several places for a library if no path is specified, allowing trojan DLL's to be inserted elsewhere even if the intended DLL is correctly protected from overwriting. Make sure to specify the full path.

rule.name: LoadLibraryW
rule.description: LoadLibrary will search several places for a library if no path is specified, allowing trojan DLL's to be inserted elsewhere even if the intended DLL is correctly protected from overwriting. Make sure to specify the full path.

rule.name: GetExtensionVersion
rule.description: GetExtensionVersion() is called by IIS in the system's security context. Be very careful what you do here, as you are basically suid root for the machine. If you are calling the function rather than implementing it, howabout *not* calling it in the system's security context if possible?

rule.name: OemToChar
rule.description: Check to be sure that the format string passed as argument 2 to this function call does not come from an untrusted source that could have added formatting characters that the code is not prepared to handle. Additionally, the format string could contain `%s' without precision that could result in a buffer overflow.

rule.description: Double check that your buffer is as big as you specify. When using functions that accept a number n of bytes to copy, such as strncpy, be aware that if the dest buffer size = n it may not NULL-terminate the string.

rule.description: Double check that your buffer is as big as you specify. When using functions that accept a number n of bytes to copy, such as strncpy, be aware that if the dest buffer size = n it may not NULL-terminate the string.

rule.name: OemToAnsi
rule.description: Check to be sure that the format string passed as argument 2 to this function call does not come from an untrusted source that could have added formatting characters that the code is not prepared to handle. Additionally, the format string could contain `%s' without precision that could result in a buffer overflow.

rule.name: OemToAnsiA
rule.description: Check to be sure that the format string passed as argument 2 to this function call does not come from an untrusted source that could have added formatting characters that the code is not prepared to handle. Additionally, the format string could contain `%s' without precision that could result in a buffer overflow.

Additionally, the format string could contain `%s' without precision that could result in a buffer overflow.

rule.description: Double check that your buffer is as big as you specify. When using functions that accept a number n of bytes to copy, such as strncpy, be aware that if the dest buffer size = n it may not NULL-terminate the string.

rule.name: OemToAnsiBuffA
rule.description: Double check that your buffer is as big as you specify. When using functions that accept a number n of bytes to copy, such as strncpy, be aware that if the dest buffer size = n it may not NULL-terminate the string.

rule.name: OemToAnsiBuffW
rule.description: Double check that your buffer is as big as you specify. When using functions that accept a number n of bytes to copy, such as strncpy, be aware that if the dest buffer size = n it may not NULL-terminate the string.

rule.name: GetTempPath
rule.description: GetTempPath() may return the current directory or the windows directory. Be careful what you place in these locations. Important files may be overwritten, and trojan DLL's may be dropped in these locations. Never use a user-input filename when writing to a location given by GetTempPath().

rule.name: GetTempPathA
rule.description: GetTempPath() may return the current directory or the windows directory. Be careful what you place in these locations. Important files may be overwritten, and trojan DLL's may be dropped in these locations. Never use a user-input filename when writing to a location given by GetTempPath().

rule.name: GetTempPathW
rule.description: GetTempPath() may return the current directory or the windows directory. Be careful what you place in these locations. Important files may be overwritten, and trojan DLL's may be dropped in these locations. Never use a user-input filename when writing to a location given by GetTempPath().

rule.name: GetTempFileName
rule.description: Many calls for generating temporary file names are insecure (susceptible to race conditions). Use a securely generated file name, for example, by pulling 64 bits of randomness from /dev/random, base 64 encoding it and using that as a file suffix.

rule.name: GetTempFileNameA
rule.description: Many calls for generating temporary file names are insecure (susceptible to race conditions). Use a securely generated file name, for example, by pulling 64 bits of randomness from /dev/random, base 64 encoding it and using that as a file suffix.

rule.name: GetTempFileNameW
rule.description: Many calls for generating temporary file names are insecure (susceptible to race conditions). Use a securely generated file name, for example, by pulling 64 bits of randomness from /dev/random, base 64 encoding it and using that as a file suffix.

rule.name: ShellExecute
rule.description: Many program execution commands under Windows will search the path for a program if you do not explicitly specify a full path to the file. This can allow trojans to be executed instead. Also, be sure to specify a file extension, since otherwise multiple extensions will be tried by the operating system, providing another opportunity for trojans.

rule.description: Many program execution commands under Windows will search the path for a program if you do not explicitly specify a full path to the file. This can allow trojans to be executed instead. Also, be sure to specify a file extension, since otherwise multiple extensions will be tried by the operating system, providing another opportunity for trojans.

rule.name: scanf
rule.description: Check to be sure that the format string passed as argument 1 to this function call does not come from an untrusted source that could have added formatting characters that the code is not prepared to handle. Additionally, the format string could contain `%s' without precision that could result in a buffer overflow.

rule.name: sscanf
rule.description: Check to be sure that the format string passed as argument 2 to this function call does not come from an untrusted source that could have added formatting characters that the code is not prepared to handle. Additionally, the format string could contain `%s' without precision that could result in a buffer overflow.

rule.name: fscanf
rule.description: Check to be sure that the format string passed as argument 2 to this function call does not come from an untrusted source that could have added formatting characters that the code is not prepared to handle. Additionally, the format string could contain `%s' without precision that could result in a buffer overflow.

rule.description: Check to be sure that the format string passed as argument 2 to this function call does not come from an untrusted source that could have added formatting characters that the code is not prepared to handle. Additionally, the format string could contain `%s' without precision that could result in a buffer overflow.

Additionally, the format string could contain `%s' without precision that could result in a buffer overflow.

rule.name: realpath
rule.description: Be sure the destination buffer is at least MAXPATHLEN big. This function may still internally overflow a static buffer, try to avoid using it. If you must, check the size the path your pass in is no longer than MAXPATHLEN.

rule.name: syslog
rule.description: Truncate all input strings to a reasonable length before passing them to this function.

rule.name: getopt
rule.description: Truncate all input strings to a reasonable length before passing them to this function.

rule.name: getopt_long
rule.description: Truncate all input strings to a reasonable length before passing them to this function.

rule.name: getpass
rule.description: Truncate all input strings to a reasonable length before passing them to this function.

rule.name: getchar
rule.description: Check buffer boundaries if calling this function in a loop and make sure you are not in danger of writing past the allocated space.

rule.name: fgetc
rule.description: Check buffer boundaries if calling this function in a loop and make sure you are not in danger of writing past the allocated space.

rule.name: getc
rule.description: Check buffer boundaries if calling this function in a loop and make sure you are not in danger of writing past the allocated space.

rule.name: read
rule.description: Check buffer boundaries if calling this function in a loop and make sure you are not in danger of writing past the allocated space.

rule.name: bcopy
rule.description: Double check that your buffer is as big as you specify. When using functions that accept a number n of bytes to copy, such as strncpy, be aware that if the dest buffer size = n it may not NULL-terminate the string.

rule.name: fgets
rule.description: Double check that your buffer is as big as you specify. When using functions that accept a number n of bytes to copy, such as strncpy, be aware that if the dest buffer size = n it may not NULL-terminate the string.

rule.name: cin
rule.description: cin is unsafe. No bounds checking is performed. Buffer is easily overflowable by user.

rule.name: memcpy
rule.description: Double check that your buffer is as big as you specify. When using functions that accept a number n of bytes to copy, such as strncpy, be aware that if the dest buffer size = n it may not NULL-terminate the string.

rule.name: fprintf
rule.description: Check to be sure that the non-constant format string passed as argument 2 to this function call does not come from an untrusted source that could have added formatting characters that the code is not prepared to handle.

rule.name: snprintf
rule.description: Double check that your buffer is as big as you specify. When using functions that accept a number n of bytes to copy, such as strncpy, be aware that if the dest buffer size = n it may not NULL-terminate the string.

rule.name: strccpy
rule.description: Double check that your buffer is as big as you specify. When using functions that accept a number n of bytes to copy, such as strncpy, be aware that if the dest buffer size = n it may not NULL-terminate the string.

rule.name: strcadd
rule.description: Double check that your buffer is as big as you specify. When using functions that accept a number n of bytes to copy, such as strncpy, be aware that if the dest buffer size = n it may not NULL-terminate the string.

rule.name: strncpy
rule.description: Double check that your buffer is as big as you specify. When using functions that accept a number n of bytes to copy, such as strncpy, be aware that if the dest buffer size = n it may not NULL-terminate the string.

rule.name: _vnsprintf
rule.description: Double check that your buffer is as big as you specify. When using functions that accept a number n of bytes to copy, such as strncpy, be aware that if the dest buffer size = n it may not NULL-terminate the string.

rule.name: tmpfile
rule.description: Many calls for generating temporary file names are insecure (susceptible to race conditions). Use a securely generated file name, for example, by pulling 64 bits of randomness from /dev/random, base 64 encoding it and using that as a file suffix.

rule.name: tmpnam
rule.description: Many calls for generating temporary file names are insecure (susceptible to race conditions). Use a securely generated file name, for example, by pulling 64 bits of randomness from /dev/random, base 64 encoding it and using that as a file suffix.

rule.name: tempnam
rule.description: Many calls for generating temporary file names are insecure (susceptible to race conditions). Use a securely generated file name, for example, by pulling 64 bits of randomness from /dev/random, base 64 encoding it and using that as a file suffix.

rule.name: getlogin
rule.description: The results of this call are easy to forge.

rule.name: cuserid
rule.description: This may be forgable. Whether it is or not, even the man page recommends against using this.

rule.name: ttyname
rule.description: The results are easy for an attacker to forge, and not reliable.

rule.name: fread
rule.description: Input source.

rule.name: recv
rule.description: Input source.

rule.name: recvfrom
rule.description: Input source.

rule.name: recvmsg
rule.description: Input source.

rule.name: readdir
rule.description: Input source.

rule.name: readlink
rule.description: Input source.

rule.name: signal
rule.description: When setting signal handlers, do not use the same function to handle multiple signals. There exists the possibility a race condition will result if 2 or more different signals are sent to the process at nearly the same time. Also, when writing signal handlers, it is best to do as little as possible in them. The best strategy is to use the signal handler to set a flag, that another part of the program tests and performs the appropriate action(s) when it is set.

rule.name: gethostbyname
rule.description: DNS results can easily be forged by an attacker (or arbitrarily set to large values, etc), and should not be trusted.

rule.name: gethostbyaddr
rule.description: DNS results can easily be forged by an attacker (or arbitrarily set to large values, etc), and should not be trusted.

rule.name: realloc
rule.description: Don't use on memory intended to be secure, because the old structure will not be zeroed out.

rule.name: fork
rule.description: Remember that sensitive data get copied on fork. For example, a random number generator's internal state will get duplicated, and the child may start outputting identical number streams.

rule.name: vfork
rule.description: Some implementations may be broken. Additionally, Remember that sensitive data get copied on fork. For example, a random number generator's internal state will get duplicated, and the child may start outputting identical number streams. Use fork() instead.

rule.name: _mbsnbcpy
rule.description: Double check that your buffer is as big as you specify. When using functions that accept a number n of bytes to copy, such as strncpy, be aware that if the dest buffer size = n it may not NULL-terminate the string.

rule.name: CopyMemory
rule.description: Double check that your buffer is as big as you specify. When using functions that accept a number n of bytes to copy, such as strncpy, be aware that if the dest buffer size = n it may not NULL-terminate the string.

rule.name: strlen
rule.description: This function does not properly handle non-NULL terminated strings. This does not result in exploitable code, but can lead to access violations.

rule.name: _tcslen
rule.description: This function does not properly handle non-NULL terminated strings. This does not result in exploitable code, but can lead to access violations.

rule.name: _mbslen
rule.description: This function does not properly handle non-NULL terminated strings. This does not result in exploitable code, but can lead to access violations.

rule.name: wcslen
rule.description: This function does not properly handle non-NULL terminated strings. This does not result in exploitable code, but can lead to access violations.

rule.description: Many program execution commands under Windows will search the path for a program if you do not explicitly specify a full path to the file. This can allow trojans to be executed instead. Also, be sure to specify a file extension, since otherwise multiple extensions will be tried by the operating system, providing another opportunity for trojans.

rule.description: Many program execution commands under Windows will search the path for a program if you do not explicitly specify a full path to the file. This can allow trojans to be executed instead. Also, be sure to specify a file extension, since otherwise multiple extensions will be tried by the operating system, providing another opportunity for trojans.

rule.name: RpcImpersonateClient
rule.description: Impersonation functions return error codes when they fail. These error codes must be checked otherwise code could be run with extra privileges when an impersonation has failed.

rule.name: RpcImpersonateLoggedOnUser
rule.description: Impersonation functions return error codes when they fail. These error codes must be checked otherwise code could be run with extra privileges when an impersonation has failed.

rule.name: CoImpersonateClient
rule.description: Impersonation functions return error codes when they fail. These error codes must be checked otherwise code could be run with extra privileges when an impersonation has failed.

rule.name: ImpersonateNamedPipeClient
rule.description: Impersonation functions return error codes when they fail. These error codes must be checked otherwise code could be run with extra privileges when an impersonation has failed.

rule.name: ImpersonateDdeClientWindow
rule.description: Impersonation functions return error codes when they fail. These error codes must be checked otherwise code could be run with extra privileges when an impersonation has failed.

rule.name: ImpersonateSecurityContext
rule.description: Impersonation functions return error codes when they fail. These error codes must be checked otherwise code could be run with extra privileges when an impersonation has failed.

rule.name: QuerySecurityContextToken
rule.description: Impersonation functions return error codes when they fail. These error codes must be checked otherwise code could be run with extra privileges when an impersonation has failed.

rule.name: SetThreadToken
rule.description: Impersonation functions return error codes when they fail. These error codes must be checked otherwise code could be run with extra privileges when an impersonation has failed.

rule.name: SetSecurityDescriptorDacl
rule.description: If the third argument, pDacl, is NULL there is no protection from attack. As an example, an attacker could set a Deny All to Everyone ACE on such an object.

rule.name: AfxLoadLibrary
rule.description: LoadLibrary will search several places for a library if no path is specified, allowing trojan DLL's to be inserted elsewhere even if the intended DLL is correctly protected from overwriting. Make sure to specify the full path.

rule.name: InitializeCriticalSection
rule.description: This function can throw exceptions in low memory conditions. Use InitialCriticalSectionAndSpinCount instead.

rule.name: EnterCriticalSection
rule.description: This function can throw exceptions in low memory conditions. Use InitialCriticalSectionAndSpinCount instead.

rule.name: _tprintf
rule.description: Check to be sure that the non-constant format string passed as argument 2 to this function call does not come from an untrusted source that could have added formatting characters that the code is not prepared to handle.

rule.name: wprintf
rule.description: Check to be sure that the non-constant format string passed as argument 2 to this function call does not come from an untrusted source that could have added formatting characters that the code is not prepared to handle.

rule.description: Check to be sure that the non-constant format string passed as argument 2 to this function call does not come from an untrusted source that could have added formatting characters that the code is not prepared to handle.

rule.description: Check to be sure that the non-constant format string passed as argument 2 to this function call does not come from an untrusted source that could have added formatting characters that the code is not prepared to handle.

rule.description: Check to be sure that the non-constant format string passed as argument 2 to this function call does not come from an untrusted source that could have added formatting characters that the code is not prepared to handle.

rule.name: catgets
rule.description: Environment variables are highly untrustable input. They may be of any length, and contain any data. Do not make any assumptions regarding content or length. If at all possible avoid using them, and if it is necessary, sanitize them and truncate them to a reasonable length. catgets() can utilize the NLSPATH environment variable.

rule.name: gettext
rule.description: Environment variables are highly untrustable input. They may be of any length, and contain any data. Do not make any assumptions regarding content or length. If at all possible avoid using them, and if it is necessary, sanitize them and truncate them to a reasonable length. gettext() can utilize the LC_ALL or LC_MESSAGES environment variables.

rule.name: strncat
rule.description: Check to be sure that the non-constant format string passed as argument 2 to this function call does not come from an untrusted source that could have added formatting characters that the code is not prepared to handle. Consider using strlcat() instead.

rule.name: getwd
rule.description: Check to be sure that the non-constant format string passed as argument 2 to this function call does not come from an untrusted source that could have added formatting characters that the code is not prepared to handle.

rule.name: umask
rule.description: umask() can easily be used to create files with unsafe priviledges. It should be set to restrictive values.

rule.name: AddAccessAllowedAce
rule.description: This function does not set the inheritance bits in the Access Controle Entry, making it vulnerable.
